original: ENGBLOM, Alexander (Alex) Natanael, överingenjör, Borås, f Södertälje 17/2 85 av skräddarm E E o Josefina Helén, gm Kerstin Holmer (d). Studex 04, John Lennings vävsk Nrkp 06, KTH (mek) 08. Mech Supt Sidney Blumenthal & Co, Textile Mills, Shelton Conn, USA, 10—17, driftsing Lithogr AB Nrkp 17—20, övering Borås Wäfveri AB sed. 20, styr.led sed. 26. Ordf IVA avd VI o dess luftbehandl.-komm, exp h 40 års sakk f högre underv o utredn rör tekn-vetensk forskn:s ordn ifråga om textilind mfl textiltekn exp.uppdr, sakk v utformn av textiltekn underv i Borås (Borås textilinst); drätselkamm 25—28 mfl kommun uppdr. Ordf stift Solhem o dir f Solhems sjukh, hed.ordf Tekn frb i Borås, styr.ordf Borås stads yrkesskolor, v. ordf De sju härad :s kult.hist frn i Borås, styr.led Borås tekn gymn o textilinst, ordf Alliance Franchise Borås. Resor : Tyskl, Engl, Frankr årl sed. 03, med undant f vist i USA 09—17. Av trycket: Ind:ell org enl d ration arb.ledn:s principer (Nät & Kult 22), Textilind o dess materialier (Hantv.insts yrkeshandb 25), textiltekn undervisn (broschyr 35), Om sv textilind :s driftsekon problem (brosch 37) samt ett st antal avh. art o före-dr i tekn, ora:anisat, soc o ekon ämnen. RNO, RVO, RFrHL; LIVA, Fellow of the Text Inst Manchester, Fellow Amer Soc of Mech Engineers, Mitgl Verein Deutsch Ing. Frimurare (IX), Rotary.°ENGBLOM, John Fredrik Teodor, överingenjör, Stockholm, f Sthlm 31/8 80 av juvelerare J F E o Josefina Ljungkrantz, gm Karin Kinch. NLatin; Öbergs priv.sk; Armour Inst of Techn Chicago 00—05, ex där. Anst v Automatic Electric Co, Chicago, f utbildn t specialist i automat telefoni 05—08, led f avd f automat telef.centraler h Telef.fabr AG vorm I Berliner, Wien, Österr, 08—15, tekn prok där 15—23, dir f Ericsson Donauländische AG 23—24, övering v Ericsson Telephones Ltd:s fabr Beeston, Nötts, 24—26, ch fabr Beeston 26. Led Sv Tekn.frn.
translated: ENGBLOM, Alexander (Alex) Natanael, chief engineer, Borås, b. Södertälje 17/2 85, son of tailor E E and Josefina Helén, m. Kerstin Holmer (d). Studied at Johns Lennings weaving school in Norrköping in 1906, and at KTH (mechanical engineering) in 1908. Worked as Mechanical Superintendent at Sidney Blumenthal & Co, Textile Mills in Shelton, Connecticut, USA, from 1910 to 1917, then as Production Manager at Lithogr AB in Norrköping from 1917 to 1920, and as Chief Engineer at Borås Wäfveri AB since 1920. Also served as board member since 1926. Chairman of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences division VI and its air treatment committee, expert in 40 years of higher education and research on organizing textile technology and other textile technical experiments. Appointed as expert in shaping textile engineering education in Borås at Borås textile institute. Member of the municipal council from 1925 to 1928 and served various other municipal appointments. Chairman of the Solhem foundation and director of Solhems hospital, honorary chairman of the Technical Association in Borås, chairman of Borås vocational schools, vice-chairman of the cultural-historical society "De sju härad" in Borås, board member of Borås technical gymnasium and textile institute, chairman of Alliance Franchise Borås. Traveled to Germany, England, and France annually since 1903, except for the years spent in the USA from 1909 to 1917. Published works on industrial organizational principles (Nät & Kult 1922), textile industry and its materials (Craft Institute's professional handbook 1925), textile engineering education (brochure 1935), problems of economic operation in the Swedish textile industry (brochure 1937), and a number of essays and lectures on technical, organizational, social, and economic subjects. Awarded the Order of the North Star, Royal Order of Vasa, Swedish Red Cross Silver Medal of Honor, member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences, Fellow of the Textile Institute in Manchester, Fellow of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers, member of the Freemason Association of German Engineers (IX), Rotary.
